trans-unit.source: Tabs and pivots are enable users to navigate between frequently accessed content.
trans-unit.target: Tabs and pivots are enable users to navigate between frequently accessed content.

trans-unit.source: Tabs and pivots
trans-unit.target: Tabs and pivots

trans-unit.source: Tabs and pivots
trans-unit.target: Tabs and pivots

trans-unit.source: Tabs and pivots are used for navigating frequently accessed, distinct content categories.
trans-unit.target: Tabs and pivots are used for navigating frequently accessed, distinct content categories.

trans-unit.source: The tab/pivot pattern is made of two or more content panes that have corresponding category headers.
trans-unit.target: The tab/pivot pattern is made of two or more content panes that have corresponding category headers.

trans-unit.source: The headers persist on-screen and have a selection state that's clearly shown, so users are always aware of which category they're in.
trans-unit.target: The headers persist on-screen and have a selection state that's clearly shown, so users are always aware of which category they're in.

trans-unit.source: An examples of tabs
trans-unit.target: An examples of tabs

trans-unit.source: Tabs and pivots are effectively the same pattern, and both are built using the [**Pivot**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.pivot.aspx) control.
trans-unit.target: Tabs and pivots are effectively the same pattern, and both are built using the [**Pivot**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.pivot.aspx) control.

trans-unit.source: The basic functionality of the Pivot control is described later in this article.
trans-unit.target: The basic functionality of the Pivot control is described later in this article.

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: Pivot class
trans-unit.target: Pivot class

trans-unit.source: The tab/pivot pattern
trans-unit.target: The tab/pivot pattern

trans-unit.source: When building an app with the tab/pivot pattern, there are a few key design variables to consider based on the pattern's configurable feature set.
trans-unit.target: When building an app with the tab/pivot pattern, there are a few key design variables to consider based on the pattern's configurable feature set.

trans-unit.source: Header placement.
trans-unit.target: Header placement.

trans-unit.source: Headers can be placed at the top or the bottom of the screen.
trans-unit.target: Headers can be placed at the top or the bottom of the screen.

trans-unit.source: **Note**  Placing headers at the bottom of the screen requires re-templating the Pivot control.
trans-unit.target: **Note**  Placing headers at the bottom of the screen requires re-templating the Pivot control.

trans-unit.source: Header labels.
trans-unit.target: Header labels.

trans-unit.source: Headers can have an icon with text, text only, or icon only.
trans-unit.target: Headers can have an icon with text, text only, or icon only.

trans-unit.source: Header alignment.
trans-unit.target: Header alignment.

trans-unit.source: Headers can be left-justified or centered.
trans-unit.target: Headers can be left-justified or centered.

trans-unit.source: Top-level or sub-level navigation.
trans-unit.target: Top-level or sub-level navigation.

trans-unit.source: Tabs/pivots can be used for either level of navigation, and can be stacked in a top-level/sub-level pattern.
trans-unit.target: Tabs/pivots can be used for either level of navigation, and can be stacked in a top-level/sub-level pattern.

trans-unit.source: When there are two levels of tabs/pivots, the top-level and sub-level headers should have enough visual differentiation so that users can clearly separate the two.
trans-unit.target: When there are two levels of tabs/pivots, the top-level and sub-level headers should have enough visual differentiation so that users can clearly separate the two.

trans-unit.source: Touch gesture support.
trans-unit.target: Touch gesture support.

trans-unit.source: For devices that support touch gestures, you can use one of two interaction sets to navigate between content categories:
trans-unit.target: For devices that support touch gestures, you can use one of two interaction sets to navigate between content categories:

trans-unit.source: Tap on a tab/pivot header to navigate to that category, or swipe on the content area to navigate to the adjacent category.
trans-unit.target: Tap on a tab/pivot header to navigate to that category, or swipe on the content area to navigate to the adjacent category.

trans-unit.source: Tap on a tab/pivot header to navigate to that category (no swipe).
trans-unit.target: Tap on a tab/pivot header to navigate to that category (no swipe).

trans-unit.source: Pattern configurations
trans-unit.target: Pattern configurations

trans-unit.source: The optimal arrangement of the tab/pivot pattern depends on the interaction scenario and the device(s) on which your app will appear.
trans-unit.target: The optimal arrangement of the tab/pivot pattern depends on the interaction scenario and the device(s) on which your app will appear.

trans-unit.source: This table outlines some of the top scenarios and pattern configurations.
trans-unit.target: This table outlines some of the top scenarios and pattern configurations.

trans-unit.source: Interaction scenario
trans-unit.target: Interaction scenario

trans-unit.source: Recommended configuration
trans-unit.target: Recommended configuration

trans-unit.source: Moving laterally between 2 to 5 top-level list or grid view content categories on a phone or phablet
trans-unit.target: Moving laterally between 2 to 5 top-level list or grid view content categories on a phone or phablet

trans-unit.source: Tab/pivots: Placed at the top of the screen, centered
trans-unit.target: Tab/pivots: Placed at the top of the screen, centered

trans-unit.source: Header labels: Icons + text
trans-unit.target: Header labels: Icons + text

trans-unit.source: Swipe on content area: Enabled
trans-unit.target: Swipe on content area: Enabled

trans-unit.source: Moving between a range of content categories on a phone or phablet in which swiping on a content area isn't practical for navigation
trans-unit.target: Moving between a range of content categories on a phone or phablet in which swiping on a content area isn't practical for navigation

trans-unit.source: Tab/pivots: Placed at the bottom of the screen, centered
trans-unit.target: Tab/pivots: Placed at the bottom of the screen, centered

trans-unit.source: Header labels: Icons + text
trans-unit.target: Header labels: Icons + text

trans-unit.source: Swipe on content area: Disabled
trans-unit.target: Swipe on content area: Disabled

trans-unit.source: Top-level navigation with a mouse and keyboard
trans-unit.target: Top-level navigation with a mouse and keyboard

trans-unit.source: Tab/pivots: Placed at the top of the screen, left-aligned
trans-unit.target: Tab/pivots: Placed at the top of the screen, left-aligned

trans-unit.source: or
trans-unit.target: or

trans-unit.source: Header labels: Text-only
trans-unit.target: Header labels: Text-only

trans-unit.source: Page-level navigation on a touch device
trans-unit.target: Page-level navigation on a touch device

trans-unit.source: Swipe on content area: Disabled
trans-unit.target: Swipe on content area: Disabled

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: This design of a food truck app shows what placing tab/pivot headers on the top or bottom can look like.
trans-unit.target: This design of a food truck app shows what placing tab/pivot headers on the top or bottom can look like.

trans-unit.source: On mobile devices, placing them at the bottom works well for reachability.
trans-unit.target: On mobile devices, placing them at the bottom works well for reachability.

trans-unit.source: An example of tabs on a mobile device
trans-unit.target: An example of tabs on a mobile device

trans-unit.source: The food truck app design on laptop/desktop features text-only headers.
trans-unit.target: The food truck app design on laptop/desktop features text-only headers.

trans-unit.source: Using icons with text for headers helps with touch targeting, but for mouse and keyboard, text-only headers work well.
trans-unit.target: Using icons with text for headers helps with touch targeting, but for mouse and keyboard, text-only headers work well.

trans-unit.source: Example of tabs on desktop
trans-unit.target: Example of tabs on desktop

trans-unit.source: Create a pivot control
trans-unit.target: Create a pivot control

trans-unit.source: The tab/pivot navigation pattern is built using the [**Pivot**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.pivot.aspx) control.
trans-unit.target: The tab/pivot navigation pattern is built using the [**Pivot**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.pivot.aspx) control.

trans-unit.source: The control comes with the basic functionality described in this section.
trans-unit.target: The control comes with the basic functionality described in this section.

trans-unit.source: This XAML creates a basic pivot control with 3 sections of content.
trans-unit.target: This XAML creates a basic pivot control with 3 sections of content.

trans-unit.source: Pivot items
trans-unit.target: Pivot items

trans-unit.source: Pivot is an [**ItemsControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.itemscontrol.aspx), so it can contain a collection of items of any type.
trans-unit.target: Pivot is an [**ItemsControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.itemscontrol.aspx), so it can contain a collection of items of any type.

trans-unit.source: Any item you add to the Pivot that is not explicitly a [**PivotItem**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.pivotitem.aspx) is implicitly wrapped in a PivotItem.
trans-unit.target: Any item you add to the Pivot that is not explicitly a [**PivotItem**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.pivotitem.aspx) is implicitly wrapped in a PivotItem.

trans-unit.source: Because a Pivot is often used to navigate between pages of content, it's common to populate the [**Items**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.itemscontrol.items.aspx) collection directly with XAML UI elements.
trans-unit.target: Because a Pivot is often used to navigate between pages of content, it's common to populate the [**Items**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.itemscontrol.items.aspx) collection directly with XAML UI elements.

trans-unit.source: Or, you can set the [**ItemsSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.itemscontrol.itemssource.aspx) property to a data source.
trans-unit.target: Or, you can set the [**ItemsSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.itemscontrol.itemssource.aspx) property to a data source.

trans-unit.source: Items bound in the ItemsSource can be of any type, but if they aren't explicitly PivotItems, you must define an [**ItemTemplate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.itemscontrol.itemtemplate.aspx) and [**HeaderTemplate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.pivot.headertemplate.aspx) to specify how the items are displayed.
trans-unit.target: Items bound in the ItemsSource can be of any type, but if they aren't explicitly PivotItems, you must define an [**ItemTemplate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.itemscontrol.itemtemplate.aspx) and [**HeaderTemplate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.pivot.headertemplate.aspx) to specify how the items are displayed.

trans-unit.source: You can use the [**SelectedItem**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.pivot.selecteditem.aspx) property to get or set the Pivot's active item.
trans-unit.target: You can use the [**SelectedItem**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.pivot.selecteditem.aspx) property to get or set the Pivot's active item.

trans-unit.source: Use the [**SelectedIndex**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.pivot.selectedindex.aspx) property to get or set the index of the active item.
trans-unit.target: Use the [**SelectedIndex**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.pivot.selectedindex.aspx) property to get or set the index of the active item.

trans-unit.source: Pivot headers
trans-unit.target: Pivot headers

trans-unit.source: You can use the [**LeftHeader**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.pivot.leftheader.aspx) and [**RightHeader**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.pivot.rightheader.aspx) properties to add other controls to the Pivot header.
trans-unit.target: You can use the [**LeftHeader**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.pivot.leftheader.aspx) and [**RightHeader**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.pivot.rightheader.aspx) properties to add other controls to the Pivot header.

trans-unit.source: Pivot interaction
trans-unit.target: Pivot interaction

trans-unit.source: The control features these touch gesture interactions:
trans-unit.target: The control features these touch gesture interactions:

trans-unit.source: Tapping on a header navigates to that header's section content.
trans-unit.target: Tapping on a header navigates to that header's section content.

trans-unit.source: Swiping left or right on a header navigates to the adjacent header/section.
trans-unit.target: Swiping left or right on a header navigates to the adjacent header/section.

trans-unit.source: Swiping left or right on section content navigates to the adjacent header/section.
trans-unit.target: Swiping left or right on section content navigates to the adjacent header/section.

trans-unit.source: The control comes in two modes:
trans-unit.target: The control comes in two modes:

trans-unit.source: Stationary
trans-unit.target: Stationary

trans-unit.source: Pivots are stationary when all pivot headers fit within the allowed space.
trans-unit.target: Pivots are stationary when all pivot headers fit within the allowed space.

trans-unit.source: Tapping on a pivot label navigates to the corresponding page, though the pivot itself will not move.
trans-unit.target: Tapping on a pivot label navigates to the corresponding page, though the pivot itself will not move.

trans-unit.source: The active pivot is highlighted.
trans-unit.target: The active pivot is highlighted.

trans-unit.source: Carousel
trans-unit.target: Carousel

trans-unit.source: Pivots carousel when all pivot headers don't fit within the allowed space.
trans-unit.target: Pivots carousel when all pivot headers don't fit within the allowed space.

trans-unit.source: Tapping a pivot label navigates to the corresponding page, and the active pivot label will carousel into the first position.
trans-unit.target: Tapping a pivot label navigates to the corresponding page, and the active pivot label will carousel into the first position.

trans-unit.source: The control has built-in breakpoint functionality, which is based on the number of headers and the string length of the labels.
trans-unit.target: The control has built-in breakpoint functionality, which is based on the number of headers and the string length of the labels.

trans-unit.source: Recommendations
trans-unit.target: Recommendations

trans-unit.source: Base the alignment of tab/pivot headers on screen size.
trans-unit.target: Base the alignment of tab/pivot headers on screen size.

trans-unit.source: For screen widths below 720 epx, center-aligning usually works better, while left-aligning for screen widths above 720 epx is recommended in most cases.
trans-unit.target: For screen widths below 720 epx, center-aligning usually works better, while left-aligning for screen widths above 720 epx is recommended in most cases.

trans-unit.source: When scaling a window, once the number of tabs/pivot headers exceeds available real estate, start pushing headers into the overflow area.
trans-unit.target: When scaling a window, once the number of tabs/pivot headers exceeds available real estate, start pushing headers into the overflow area.

trans-unit.source: Tabs/pivots can be used in either screen orientation, but be sure to maintain the same total number of headers (visible and hidden) in both landscape and portrait orientations.
trans-unit.target: Tabs/pivots can be used in either screen orientation, but be sure to maintain the same total number of headers (visible and hidden) in both landscape and portrait orientations.

trans-unit.source: Avoid using more than 5 headers when using carousel (round-trip) mode, as having more than 5 can cause the user to lose orientation.
trans-unit.target: Avoid using more than 5 headers when using carousel (round-trip) mode, as having more than 5 can cause the user to lose orientation.

trans-unit.source: On mobile devices, placing tabs/pivots at the bottom works well for reachability, if swiping is used in another part of the UI, and to avoid top-heavy UI.
trans-unit.target: On mobile devices, placing tabs/pivots at the bottom works well for reachability, if swiping is used in another part of the UI, and to avoid top-heavy UI.

trans-unit.source: When the on-screen keyboard is deployed, headers can move off-screen to preserve space.
trans-unit.target: When the on-screen keyboard is deployed, headers can move off-screen to preserve space.

trans-unit.source: \[This article contains information that is specific to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[This article contains information that is specific to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.1 guidance, please download the [Windows 8.1 guidelines PDF](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=258743).\]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.1 guidance, please download the [Windows 8.1 guidelines PDF](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=258743).\]
